Tannin Characteristics: Fine-grained and balanced, providing structure without harshness.
Body Characteristics: Full, well-structured, harmonious; fresh softness and savory, round flavor.
Finish Characterstics: Lingering savory finish with a soft, round close.
Aroma: Red fruit, mature cherry, raspberry, and sweet notes of tobacco.
Flavor: Juicy cherry and raspberry with a touch of sweet tobacco and earthy depth.
Vinification: In steel tanks. 10–12 days maceration with skins using a soft 'shower' system. Malolactic fermentation in steel.
Maturation: Aged 12 months in large oak casks before bottle refinement. Minimum aging of 18 months.
General Recommended Accompanies: Cured meats, pasta with meat sauce, risotto, fillet, guinea fowl, medium-aged goat cheeses.
Stella Recommended: Gnocchi di Patate “Nonna Nilla” (Italian sausage and porcini ragu), Rigatoni al Ragu di Maiale, Filetto
Summary: Cipressi from Nizza DOCG is a **full-bodied**, **expressive Barbera** crafted with care at the La Court vineyard in Calamandrana. Inspired by the symbolic cypress trees and the rugged beauty of the land, it offers **bright red fruit**, **soft spice**, and a **harmonious savory finish**.

Tannin Characteristics: Velvety and fine, softened by oak ageing.
Body Characteristics: Amazingly fresh and rich, with silky acidity and pleasant texture.
Aroma: Wide and vinous with notes of violet, cherry, currant, plum, and spices.
Flavor: Fresh and balanced with vibrant fruit, velvety texture, and hints of oak.
Vinification: Must is cooled before fermentation in stainless steel at controlled temperature. Medium maceration using délestage for over 18 days.
Maturation: Aged for 8 months in medium-size oak casks.
Color: Deep ruby red with typical purple hues.
General Recommended Accompanies: Pasta, risotto, roasted meats, cheese, and salami.
Stella Recommended: Gnocchi di Patate “Nonna Nilla” (Italian sausage and porcini ragu), Rigatoni al Ragu di Maiale, Maiale con Pancetta e Aglio
Summary: Pajena Barbera d’Alba DOC 2021 by Enrico Serafino showcases the elegance and richness of Barbera, with fresh acidity, velvety texture, and deep fruit expression. Crafted from hand-harvested grapes and aged in large oak casks, it is both impressive and balanced.

Tannin Characteristics: Firm but refined, with a velvety edge and integrated structure.
Body Characteristics: Full-bodied and velvety with a persistent, balanced finish.
Finish Characterstics: Persistent aftertaste with soft structure and elegant balance.
Aroma: Complex aromas of red fruit and hints of spices.
Flavor: Red fruit, soft spice, velvety texture, and a long, balanced finish.
Vinification: Grapes were destemmed and crushed, followed by 8 days of skin maceration at a max of 30°C. Malolactic fermentation completed before end of winter.
Maturation: Aged approximately one year in oak barrels of varying capacities.
Stella Recommended: Osso Buco di Vitello, Scottadito di Agnello, Filetto
Summary: Prunotto Barbaresco 2021 is a refined and expressive Nebbiolo from Treiso and Neive. Aged for one year in large oak barrels, it delivers complex red fruit and spice aromas with a velvety, full-bodied texture and long, balanced finish.

Stella Recommended: Osso Buco di Vitello, Scottadito di Agnello, Spezzatino al Barolo
Tannin Characteristics: Structured and soft, showing approachability and polish despite firm tannin presence.
Body Characteristics: Excellent structure, harmony and elegance with balanced fruit and firm but soft tannins.
Aroma: Ripe black cherry, cinnamon-spiced cake, candied blood orange zest, and a hint of fresh bay leaf.
Flavor: Classic Barolo expression with integrated tannins, balanced fruit, and long aging potential.
Vinification: Fermented in stainless steel; skin contact and maceration for about 25–30 days.
Maturation: Aged about 30 months in large French oak 'botti', with a small portion in barriques.
Type of cask: Large French oak botti and some barriques
Vineyard: Multiple vineyards: Serralunga d’Alba (Ornato, La Serra, Briccolina), Grinzane Cavour (Gustava, Garretti), La Morra (Roncaglie), Novello (Ravera), Monforte (Mosconi)
Summary: Pio Cesare Barolo 2019 is a classic DOCG Nebbiolo crafted from a blend of top vineyard sites across Barolo. Aged for 30 months in large French oak with a touch of barrique, it balances structure, elegance, and aging potential with soft tannins and harmonious fruit.

Stella Recommended: Osso Buco di Vitello, Scottadito di Agnello, Spezzatino al Barolo
Tannin Characteristics: Elegant, firm tannins with potential for long aging and structural depth.
Body Characteristics: Full-bodied, classic and well-structured with aging potential and evolving complexity.
Finish Characterstics: Persistent with complexity that evolves over time.
Aroma: Broad spectrum of aromas from spicy notes to sweeter floral and fruity tones.
Flavor: Structured and expressive, offering floral, fruity, and spicy layers with firm Nebbiolo character.
Vinification: Long fermentation and maceration in oak fermenters ('tini') around 30°C. Aged in large Slavonian oak casks up to 30 months, followed by bottle aging in cool, dark cellars.
Maturation: Up to 30 months in large Slavonian oak, plus bottle aging.
Vineyard: Multiple vineyards across the Barolo hills
General Recommended Accompanies: Red meats (especially game), dishes with truffle, fresh egg pasta with meat sauce, risotto, medium-mature cow’s and goat’s milk cheeses.
Summary: Massolino Barolo DOCG 2019 represents a traditional, high-level expression of Barolo using fruit from various terroirs. Aged in Slavonian oak for up to 30 months, it offers floral, spicy, and fruity notes with firm tannins, elegant balance, and great aging potential.
Sustainability: Sustainable viticulture practices, including organic fertilization and minimal intervention in the vineyard.

Tannin Characteristics: Barely outlined noble tannins with elegant balance and subtle persistence.
Body Characteristics: Refined structure showing freshness and minerality with lingering complexity.
Finish Characteristics: Subtle and persistent finish with hints of minerals and iron.
Aroma: Soft floral aromas of violets and rose petals, evolving into spice and balsamic notes.
Flavor: Small red fruits, fruit jellies, delicate florals, spice, and mineral tones.
Vinification: Not specified in the PDF, but typical Gattinara DOCG practices include long maceration and aging in oak.
Maturation: Not detailed; traditionally aged in large Slavonian oak casks and bottle-aged before release.
Type of cask: Likely large oak (traditional for Gattinara DOCG)
Color: Vintage and bright ruby red with delicate transparency
General Recommended Accompanies: Ideal with truffle dishes, aged cheeses, braised meats, and mushroom risotto.
Stella Recommended: Osso Buco di Vitello, Scottadito di Agnello, Spezzatino al Barolo
Summary: Travaglini’s signature Gattinara is a refined expression of Nebbiolo from northern Piemonte. With floral aromas, red fruit, and mineral complexity, this DOCG wine balances noble tannins and freshness with a subtle, persistent finish, reflecting the Travaglini family’s deep connection to the terroir.

Wine Name: Pian delle Vigne Brunello di Montalcino
Tannin Characteristics: Silky and elegant with refined grip and mouthfeel.
Body Characteristics: Fresh and savory with richness balanced by vibrancy and structure from large cask aging.
Finish Characteristics: Persistent with citrus, spice, and vanilla notes.
Aroma: Complex bouquet of cherries, black cherries, blood oranges, violets, vanilla, and balsamic notes.
Flavor: Cherries, blood orange, delicate spice, violet, and vanilla on a savory backbone.
Vinification: Fermented in stainless steel; macerated for 12 days at 28°C. Malolactic fermentation completed before aging.
Maturation: Aged 2 years in large oak barrels, followed by extended bottle aging.
Vineyard: Pian delle Vigne estate, 6 km SW of Montalcino; south-west exposure at 130m elevation.
General Recommended Accompanies: Pairs well with grilled meats, aged cheeses, mushroom risotto, and truffle dishes.
Stella Recommended: Osso Buco, Spezzatini, lasagna Filetto Bolognese
Summary: **Pian delle Vigne 2019** is a **vibrant Brunello di Montalcino** from **Antinori’s estate southwest of Montalcino**. **Aged in large oak casks**, it shows aromas of **cherry, blood orange, violet, and balsamic spice**. The palate is **savory and fresh** with **silky tannins** and a **long, elegant finish**.

Blend: Primarily Sangiovese with small percentages of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc
Tannin Characteristics: Supple, vibrant tannins with structure and finesse.
Body Characteristics: Rich and sophisticated with powerful concentration and layered complexity.
Finish Characteristics: Persistent with notes of dark fruit, tobacco, and licorice.
Aroma: Ripe plums, blackberries, candied orange peel, dark chocolate, caramel, licorice, and sweet tobacco.
Flavor: Blackberry, plum, candied citrus, dark chocolate, tobacco, and spice.
Vinification: Fermented in conical tanks with maceration on skins, followed by racking and malolactic fermentation in small oak barrels.
Maturation: Aged in French and Hungarian oak (predominantly new) for about 15 months, plus 12 months in bottle.
Color: Ruby red with intense purple hues
Vineyard: Tignanello estate, 350–400m elevation, limestone-rich soils, southwest exposure
General Recommended Accompanies: Ideal with Bistecca alla Fiorentina, wild boar ragù, aged cheeses, or braised short ribs.
Summary: **Tignanello 2021** is a **landmark Super Tuscan** from Antinori’s historic vineyard in the Chianti Classico zone. **Aged in French and Hungarian oak**, it shows **layers of ripe black fruit, chocolate, tobacco, and vibrant tannins**. A benchmark vintage marked by elegance, power, and remarkable aging potential.

Blend: 85% Sangiovese (Prugnolo Gentile), 15% Colorino, Canaiolo, and Merlot
Tannin Characteristics: Elegant, with structure and refinement from oak and native Sangiovese character.
Body Characteristics: Structured and layered, with richness from traditional and modern oak aging.
Finish Characteristics: Persistent and savory with earthy, spiced fruit and subtle oak tones.
Aroma: Floral and red cherry notes with touches of earth, spice, and dried herbs.
Flavor: Red berries, plum, baking spices, and hints of toasted wood and clay.
Vinification: Optical grape sorting, fermented in 6,000–8,000L French oak vats using vineyard-selected yeast, followed by malolactic fermentation.
Maturation: 18–20 months in French oak: 20% barriques, 40% tonneaux, 40% large casks; followed by 6–8 months in bottle.
Type of cask: French oak – mix of barrique, tonneaux, and large 3,500L casks
Vineyard: Estate vineyards in Montepulciano at 300–420m elevation; clay and silt soils with embedded fossils
General Recommended Accompanies: Pairs well with roasted pork, lamb ragu, grilled meats, and Tuscan pecorino.
Stella Recommended: Filetto, Rigatoni al Ragu Maiale with pancetta and aglio
Summary: **Poliziano’s 2021 Vino Nobile di Montepulciano** blends **85% Prugnolo Gentile (Sangiovese)** with traditional Tuscan grapes for **structure, elegance, and depth**. Grown sustainably at high elevation and aged in a mix of French oak casks, it shows **cherry, spice, and earthy minerality** with a long, noble finish.
Sustainability: Sustainable farming practices; vines aged 3–53 years.

Tannin Characteristics: Firm yet elegant tannins from skin maceration and oak aging.
Body Characteristics: Structured and vibrant with earthy tones and red fruit richness.
Finish Characteristics: Bright, with fresh acidity and lingering cherry and spice notes.
Aroma: Red berry and cherry aromas with earthy under-notes.
Flavor: Cherry, red berries, and earth with freshness and depth.
Vinification: Hand harvested, destemmed, crushed, fermented on skins in stainless steel. Underwent malolactic fermentation and oak aging.
Maturation: 24 months in oak barrels, followed by 3 months in bottle.
Vineyard: Nozzole estate near Greve in Chianti, elevation 984 ft
General Recommended Accompanies: Excellent with roast meats, game, mushroom pasta, and aged pecorino.
Summary: **Nozzole’s Chianti Classico Riserva 2021** is a **classic 100% Sangiovese** from estate vineyards near Greve in Chianti. With **vibrant acidity, firm tannins, and red berry character**, it reflects the **Folonari family’s long tradition** of crafting age-worthy Tuscan reds.

Wine Name: Tenuta di Arceno Chianti Classico Riserva
Tannin Characteristics: Soft, round edges from a cooler vintage with savory complexity.
Body Characteristics: Elegant and savory with ripe red fruit, floral lift, and subtle oak.
Finish Characteristics: Lingers with black tea, citrus tones, and pleasant minerality.
Aroma: Cedar, cypress, rose, raspberry, and vanilla bean.
Flavor: Strawberries, cherry liqueur, cacao, coconut, and ripe orange.
Vinification: Harvested between Sept 18 and Oct 23. Fermentation in stainless, aged 10 months in neutral French oak.
Vineyard: Estate vineyards in San Gusmè, Castelnuovo Berardenga, Siena
General Recommended Accompanies: Perfect with grilled meats, Tuscan stews, aged cheese, or rosemary pork.
Stella Recommended: Scottadito, Spezzatino, Gnocchi Nonna Nilla with gorgonzola sauce
Summary: **Tenuta di Arceno’s 2019 Chianti Classico Riserva** balances **Sangiovese purity and Cabernet depth** in a cooler vintage. **Aromas of cedar, rose, raspberry, and vanilla** lead into a savory palate of cherry, cacao, and black tea. **Elegant and mineral-driven**, this is a refined, age-worthy expression.

Tannin Characteristics: Soft and elegant tannins with subtle wood influence from barrel aging.
Body Characteristics: Fresh and refined with balanced fruit and savory earth tones.
Finish Characteristics: Clean and subtle with a touch of spice and dark fruit.
Aroma: Primary fruit aromas with hints of red berries and herbs; subtle oak.
Flavor: Cherry, red plum, dried herbs, light spice, and earthy minerality.
Vinification: Fermented in stainless steel at 25–28°C; macerated for 12 days. Full malolactic fermentation.
Maturation: Aged 12 months in 225L French oak barrels (20% new, 80% used).
Vineyard: High hill vineyards between 450 and 750 meters a.s.l.
General Recommended Accompanies: Ideal with roast chicken, meaty pastas, herb-crusted pork, or Sicilian street food.
Stella Recommended: Milanese di Pollo, Maiale con Pancetta e Aglio, Spaghetti Bolognese
Summary: **Lamùri 2022** from **Tenuta Regaleali** is a high-elevation **Nero d’Avola** aged in French oak to express **purity, freshness, and Sicilian character**. With **soft tannins, red fruit, and subtle spice**, it’s a refined and elegant take on Sicily’s flagship grape.

Tannin Characteristics: Elegant and softened by Merlot’s velvety texture, balanced with Nebbiolo’s structure.
Body Characteristics: Dry and vigorous with a clean finish and savory lift.
Finish Characteristics: Bright and persistent with floral and raspberry notes.
Aroma: Ethery nose with berry fruit, raspberry jam, roses, violets, and a grassy note.
Flavor: Delicate raspberry, floral tones, and subtle herbal lift.
Vinification: Grapes hang ultra-ripe; macerated 10 days on skins, followed by cold fermentation in stainless steel.
Maturation: 18 months in large French and Slavonian oak vats.
Type of cask: Large French and Slavonian oak vats
Vineyard: Terraced vineyards facing S, SE, SW at 900–1600 ft with shallow sandy loam soil.
General Recommended Accompanies: Game, roasted red meats, aged cheeses.
Stella Recommended: Milanese do Pollo, Maiale con Pancetta e Aglio, Spaghetti Bolognese
Summary: **Valtellina Superiore Quadrio 2020** by Nino Negri blends **90% Nebbiolo and 10% Merlot**, offering a unique expression from Lombardy’s terraced slopes. With **garnet color, floral aromatics, and a dry, vigorous palate**, it’s a fresh and approachable take on mountain Nebbiolo.

Tannin Characteristics: Structured and velvety tannins balanced by dried fruit concentration.
Body Characteristics: Rich and intense with dried cherry, prune, spice, and cocoa notes.
Finish Characteristics: Lingering with dark fruit, balsamic spice, and fine tannic grip.
Aroma: Ripe cherries, dried fruit, cinnamon, tobacco, and cocoa.
Flavor: Powerful yet elegant with dried fig, cherry liqueur, warm spices, and oak.
Vinification: Traditional Amarone method with appassimento: grapes dried for 90-100 days, followed by fermentation at low temperature for 30-40 days.
Maturation: Aged for 36 months in Slavonian oak casks and French barriques.
Type of cask: Slavonian oak casks and French barriques
Color: Deep ruby red with garnet hues
Vineyard: Hills of Marano, Fumane, and San Pietro in Cariano in Valpolicella Classico zone
General Recommended Accompanies: Roasted meats, aged cheeses, game, or as a meditation wine.
Stella Recommended: Osso Buco, Scottadito, Gnocchi with Gorgonzola Sauce
Summary: **Campagnola Amarone della Valpolicella Classico** is crafted from **hand-selected grapes naturally dried for 100 days**, then aged in both **large oak** and **French barriques**. This **full-bodied Amarone** delivers rich layers of **cherry, plum, almond, and vanilla**, with a **long, elegant finish**.

Tannin Characteristics: Balanced and soft with subtle grip from oak aging.
Body Characteristics: Juicy and structured with ripe fruit depth and a warm mouthfeel.
Finish Characteristics: Persistent with spice and prune notes.
Aroma: Morello cherry, sour cherry, prune, floral hints, and spice.
Flavor: Bright cherry fruit with dried plum and a touch of spice from oak.
Style: Warm and fruit-driven Southern Italian red
Vinification: 6–8 day maceration in stainless steel; aged 6 months in American oak barriques, then 2 months in bottle.
Maturation: 6 months in barriques, 2 months in bottle
Color: Ruby red with delicate garnet undertones
Vineyard: Various vineyard plots in Salento with sandy soils and 15–40 year-old vines at 20–40m elevation.
General Recommended Accompanies: Pizza, red-sauced pastas, baked dishes, tuna, swordfish.
Summary: **Cantele’s Primitivo Puglia IGP** is a southern Italian classic, made from **100% Primitivo** grown in sandy Salento soils. Aged in American oak, it offers **ripe cherry, prune, spice, and a juicy, medium-full body**, making it a versatile pairing for both red meats and seafood.

Tannin Characteristics: Moderate tannins typical of Barbera and Nebbiolo, with structure retained by steel aging.
Body Characteristics: Fresh and balanced due to cool fermentation and stainless steel aging.
Finish Characteristics: Clean and crisp with bright red fruit notes lingering on the palate.
Aroma: Bright red fruit and subtle floral hints.
Flavor: Red berries, tangy acidity, and fresh finish.
Vinification: Hand-harvested grapes fermented and aged in stainless steel at cool temperatures.
Maturation: Aged in stainless steel to preserve freshness.
Vineyard: Vineyards located in the Langhe and Monferrato
General Recommended Accompanies: Great with pizza, pasta with red sauce, grilled vegetables, and cured meats.
Stella Recommended: Gnocchi di Patate “Nonna Nilla” (Italian sausage and porcini ragu), Rigatoni al Ragu di Maiale, Pollo alla Parmigiana
Summary: Barbera 'Vezzi' by Gotham Project is a fresh, vibrant red from Langhe and Monferrato in Piemonte. Made from 90% Barbera and 10% Nebbiolo, it’s fermented and aged in stainless steel for crispness and energy. Sustainable farming practices highlight the fruit purity and bright acidity.
Sustainability: Sustainable farming practices are used in the vineyard.

Tannin Characteristics: Finely integrated tannin structure gently supports the palate.
Body Characteristics: Harmonious palate of saturated dark red fruits with a smooth structure.
Finish Characteristics: Lingering notes of toast, vanilla, and dried dark fruits.
Aroma: Savory rosemary and forest floor, black raspberry, with toasty oak spice.
Flavor: Dried cherry, blackberry, plum, with a hint of vanilla and toast.
Vinification: Grapes from different terrains of Tuscany fermented and blended to reflect regional characteristics.
Maturation: Not specified in detail; includes exposure to oak contributing toast and vanilla notes.
Vineyard: Valdarno hills and Chianti region; Merlot & Syrah from marlstone-rich soil, Sangiovese from high elevation vineyards.
General Recommended Accompanies: Pastas, meat dishes, charcuterie, pizza, and blue cheese.
Summary: The Merlot & Syrah are produced in the Valdarno hills where the soil is rich in marlstone and clay; the sun is notably bright, but nights are cool – important for optimum ripening of these grapes. The Sangiovese is planted at the highest elevation of the Chianti region. This wine expresses the fresh scents and balanced flavors associated with the vineyards of Castello di Querceto
